turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Otherwise whatever we're looking for could be anywhere.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Basically.  But the map has been pretty precise so far.  I don't think it'll be too hard to--

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Where'd they go?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: I don't know.  There's a lot of space up here.  They could be just about--

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Weird they didn't chase us.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: And they can't fly around out there forever.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: So we wait.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Missile!

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Move!

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: All right.  Let's break out some utility shovels, lanterns, and a claymore in case we have to do any blasting.  Me and Jaeger'll climb down, and see what we can see.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: What am I supposed to do?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Got to have someone here in case we need help making it back up.  Doesn't hurt to have a look out either.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Epps!

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: I heard!

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: I don't think the line will take the weight of a man and the coins.  Wes!?  We'll send the gold up, then me and Jaeger'll climb back.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Ready when you are.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: You ready?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: All right.  I'll go up, then you send up the gold and--

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: It'll be too dark to make our way back now.  Let's bed down for the night and head out at first light.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: What about the gold?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: What about it?

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Maybe we should split it up now.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: We started this together, and we're staying together, so there's no point in splitting things up now.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: What if we get separated?  Way I see it if something happens I want to be carrying my share.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: You're the one with all the ideas.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: You've had your say, Wes.  Now leave it.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Maybe you've got ideas of your own for the gold.  Maybe you've already got things worked out.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Maybe I do.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Maybe I don't need your ideas.  Maybe I can do better on my own.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: You got no reason to do that!

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: I told you:  When I straighten someone out they stay straightened.  This is how it works:  Nobody touches the gold. Except when we're on the move and someone's carrying it, nobody so much as opens the pack to get an eyeful of it. Agreed?

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: You got no reason to hit me.  I'm getting tired of you and Jaeger pushing me around.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Then get up and do something about it.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Get off him.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: He snuck in here thinking we were asleep, only I wasn't sleeping.  Would have slit our throats if I hadn't stopped him.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Get off him!

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: I told you.  He tried to steal our gold. He tried to kill us.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Stop it!

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: I told you; don't push me around.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Says they were deserters, they were afraid to fight, don't believe in Saddam anyway.  They flew the gunship up here to hide out.  When they saw us they figured we were going to kill them, so they shot first.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Why'd he come in our camp.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Says he wanted food.  Liar.  He wanted the gold.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: How's he going to want the gold?  He couldn't even know we had it.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: He...he could have been watching us.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: I don't care what he says, he wanted our gold.  Would have slit our throats if he had the chance.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Doesn't matter.  Whatever he wanted he didn't get it.  We've got no need staying around here.  It's light enough.  Let's pack up and head out.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: We can't just leave him.  He'll run back to his outfit, report our position...

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: You said he was a deserter.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: That's what he says.  He could be a spy, or something.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: You don't know that.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: You don't know he isn't.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: You're out of your mind.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: He's an enemy soldier.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: I'm not going to let you kill him.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: We're at war.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: We are not at war!  You and I and Jaeger are AWOL.  We have no authority--

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: He tried to kill us.  If not just now, then in the helicopter.  That's all the authority I need.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: I'm not going to leave him be just so he can stab us in the backs the minute we turn around.  I have been through too much to lose it all now just because the two of you don't have the stomach to do what has to be done.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: I've got no stomach for murder.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: It's a combat action.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: It's murder, and I won't be any part of it.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Then step aside.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Get out of my way.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: You've got an awful lot of orders in you. Always giving orders.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: I out rank you, that's why.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: In the service you do, but we're not particularly in the service right now. Way I see it, what we're doing, that doesn't particularly give you the right to toss orders around.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: We been down this road.  I told you how it is.  Unless you feel like there's something you want to do about it...

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: What if I do?

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: No navicom.  A lot of good you are now, Epps.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Lot of good you were when I was sinking in the sand.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Without that navicam looks to me like you forfeit the right to be in charge.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: And let me guess who is.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: I'm the one's got the big stick.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Suppose I don't go for that?

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Then I suppose it'd be insurrection, and I suppose I'd have to kill you.  I suppose.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: What about Jaeger?

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Nothing about him, unless he's got a problem about me dealing with you.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: In the flack jacket.  Still like getting hit in the back with a baseball bat. Took the air right out of me, but I was just unconscious for awhile.  'Course, you didn't stick around to find that out. You left me for dead.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: We thought--

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Wes, we thought you were dead, and we thought we were next.  Hanging around to get killed wouldn't have done anyone any good.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Sure, and I guess it was just convenient there was one less person to split the gold with.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Wes--

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Look, I know you guys are telling the truth.  It's just the Shi'ites don't know that.  I guess you could tell them...but then you don't speak the language do you?

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Thanks for taking care of this for me.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Tell me something, Wes.  Are you crazy, greedy, or just stupid?  Jaeger says you're crazy.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: You disappoint me, Epps.  Always figured you to be a man; a real bright guy.  I had respect for you.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: That why you tried to put a bullet in my head in the middle of the desert.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: That's just what things came to. Sometimes you can't help that.  It doesn't change me respecting you.  And now you let me down.  I expected more from you, you know?  I really did.  I expected you to--

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: They'll kill you.  You won't make it ten feet before they cut you down.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: You don't know John Epps very well, do you?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Just keep quiet.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: I have to answer him.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: So you can give us away?

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: If I don't answer, he'll know something's up.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Give it to me!

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: If I give it to you, will you let us go?

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Looks like at the end of the day we finally find out who's better than who, don't we, Epps?  Like I said; I expected more from you.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: It's like I said; you don't really know lieutenant John Epps very well, do you?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: At-at-at-at-at.  At-at-at-at-at.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: What does it look like I'm doing?  I'm killing Iraqis.  At-at-at-at-at.  At-at- at-at--

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: At-at-at-at-at.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Knock it off!

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Don't get pissed at me, just 'cause I want to be ready when this war starts.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Ready for what?  What are you supposed to be doing?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I told you, I'm shooting Iraqis.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: No you're not.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: You know what?  I think you got Schwarzkopf.  You did!  You got the General right in the ass.  Now that's good shooting.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Blow me.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Another month in this desert and I might just.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Don't worry about Jaeger.  He uses his personality as a form of birth control.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Blow me.  Have I said that to you guys recently?  Blow me.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Oh, man, you're not going to fall for that.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: There might be something in there.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Yeah, the deed to the Brooklyn bridge.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: There might be.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: This is stupid.  It's going on a month now.  How long are they going to let the Air Force piss on those bastards?  They can bomb them all they want, Saddam ain't going anywhere without a ground assault. What the hell is the army waiting for?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Why you in such a hurry to get to shooting?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I've got to have something to tell people when I get home besides I protected a stretch of dirt that nobody wanted for nothing in the first place.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: You all want to lay off?  God.  I hope the Iraqis shoot me; put me out of my misery.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: OH MY GOD!

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: What!?  What!?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I did it!  I got the box open.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: You think?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Yeah, that's exactly what I think.  You and the five thousand other suckers who bought those boxes.  Let's get out of here.  We got sand to protect.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: They finally start the ground war, and where are we?  Same place we've been since we got here.  Securing freedom for the dirt.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Everybody's got a job to do.  Figure it this way:  At least you get to go home alive.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I'd like to go home alive with a couple of Iraqi scalps hanging from my belt.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Don't even.  You're not going to show me that tired map.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Wait.  Wait.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: I think you've got some issues to deal with.  Really, when we get out of here I'm pretty sure it's shrink time for you.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Just listen to me!  I've been doing some reading.  In the Sixteenth century this region was invaded by the Turks.  It became part of the Ottoman empire.  When the Turks rolled in they raped, they pillaged, the usual stuff.  Anybody who had anything wanted to hide it from these bastards.  They buried their treasures, drew maps, and hid the maps in puzzle boxes.  I read about this, man.  I read about it.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Wellllll, if you read it it must be true. Was it in the Star, or the Enquirer?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Christ!  Wes, tell him.  You know this stuff.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: And you know what that area is?  It's Iraq.  IRAQ!  We're doing a little thing with them right now; Desert Storm.  Maybe you've read about it.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: What we're doing is kicking ass.  For God's sake they got Iraqis surrendering to news crews.  The war is over.  We've just got to keep shooting people 'cause the army spent all this money, and we've got to put on a show for the taxpayers.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: It's war.  People get lost all the time in war, cut off--

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: We disappear for awhile.  We disappear, we came back; nobody knows nothing.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: But we all got to be in for this.  We all go, or we do nothing.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: It's going to be cool, Wes.  It's all all right.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: We go, we get rich, we go home.  It's that easy.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Now this is war.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Roger that.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: You're such a pussy, you know that? How'd you get in the army?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Cool it, Jaeger.  Hey, Wes?  Wes?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: But that's the great thing about Gold.  A little goes a long way.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: You know what I'm doing with my part of the gold?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Third.  What you're going to do with your third.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Yeah.  I meant... You know what I'm going to do with it?  I'm going to buy a Sixty- three 'Vette Stingray.  All tricked out and cherry.  I'm going to be so sweet.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: A car?  You're going to buy a car?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: You're getting gold, and you're going to blow it on wheels?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: What are you going to do with your <u>third</u>?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Invest it.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Oh, that's fun.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: It's not about being fun.  It's about being smart.  You take that money, you take care of it, let it grow, and you don't ever have to do anything again. Ever.  That's freedom.  That's what I'm talking about.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: And I'm talking about enjoying myself.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: You know, you sound just like a boy who's never--

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Take the binoculars.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Wh-what do you think--

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: TAKE THE GODDAMN BINOCULARS!

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Shut up!  Both of you shut the hell up!

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: We've got to do something.  We've got to turn around.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: We can see them, they can see us.  We run, they chase.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: They'll shoot us!

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: We run they'll shoot us anyway.  If we keep driving they might think we friendlies; Iraqis.  Or even if they know we're Americans they might get scared, think we're part of a detachment and keep on going.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: They're not going to--

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: It's the only way.  We drive!

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Figure they don't want to mess with us anymore than we want to mess with them.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Look at you, not even breaking a sweat. You're cool, boy.  You're cool.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Steady it out!

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: I steady it out, they blow us out of the sand!

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: She okay?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Yeah.  Yeah, she's fine.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Let's go.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I'm just thinking, you know, if the rest of the boys knew what we're doing.  I mean if they knew what we were coming back with.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: You can't tell anybody about this.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I know.  I know.  But I'm saying, if they knew.  We're going to be millionaires, man.  Millionaires!

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: It'd make their heads explode.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Millionaires, man.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Look at it.  LOOK AT IT!  Shot to hell. It's been leaking gas since the fire fight.  I told you to check for damage.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: ...I know.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: And you missed this?  How are you going to miss something like this?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I didn't miss it.  I figured if you knew one of the reserves got hit you'd want to turn back.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: What do we do with the Humvee?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: We leave it.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: SAY IT!

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I got that...sir.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Hey...hey!  Slow up.  You don't have to go so fast.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Faster we get there, faster we get back.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Yeah.  I know.  I'm with you.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I'm gonna...I'm just gonna stop for a little water.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Don't drink up all of yours, 'cause you aren't getting any of ours.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I'm just going to have a little sip, that's all.  Just a sip.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: What!?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Mine.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Mine.  Land mine!

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: You didn't step on any mine.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I heard it click.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: If you stepped on a mine you'd be dead by now.  Nobody uses delayed-fuse mines anymore.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I heard it.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Oh, God!  Oh God!

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Just be cool.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: It's a mine, isn't it?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Just relax.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: How'm I gonna relax standing on a mine!?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: We're going to get off, all right.  We'll get you off of there.  Just...be cool.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Where you going?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Me and Wes are just going to talk.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Why you got to move away to talk!?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: We're going to be right over here.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: You're moving away because it's going to blow up, isn't it!?  It's going to blow up!

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: I said be cool, all right?  Now be cool!

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: There's a way.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Epps...

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: I said nobody dies.  Nobody dies.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Epps, my leg is falling asleep.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: My leg is falling asleep.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: It's not falling asleep.  You've only been standing there for three minutes.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I'm the one who can feel my leg, and it's falling asleep.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: It falls asleep and you die, so wake it the hell up.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: How's this going to work?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Me and Wes each going take an end of the rope, run our asses of, and yank you off the mine.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: That's going to do it, right?  I'm going to be okay.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: You're going to be fine.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: You're not going to let me die, are you!? Don't let me die!

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: When we start running suck up your breath.  You're going to get the wind knocked out of you.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Don't let me die, Epps.  I don't want to die.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: You're going to blow yourselves up.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Wes is right.  If there were any more mines we would have found them.  Hell, that one you stepped on was probably old anyway; left over from the war with Iran.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: You don't know that.  It could be a trick.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: If we step on a mine we'll know it was. Let me see the maps.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: This.  Whatever it is.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: It's the treasure, that's what it is.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: You're not losing trust, are you?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Just figure it's my map, I ought to hang on to it.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: I didn't have to stop anything, 'cause nobody was going to do nothing.  We're in this together, understand?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Yeah, I understand.  Wes doesn't want to come along in the first place, but he gets a third of the find.  That's a sweet deal.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I don't hear any--

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Shut up and listen!

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Don't!

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: It's a fire fight.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Single shots doesn't mean a fire fight. That's not a battle going on.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Iraqis.  A bunch of them.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: What are they doing here?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Well, it's Iraq.  I'm not sure, but I'm guessing that has something to do with them being here.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: What are they doing in the middle of nowhere?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: They're doing more than slapping.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: The Shi'ites are on our side?  I didn't know that.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Not enough.  We're out numbered and out gunned.  They'd cut us to shreds.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: So good bye, Shi'ites.  Thanks for playing.  We have some lovely parting gifts for you as you go.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: X marks the spot.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Something like that.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: But the white dot in the middle; that's got to mean something.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: I hope it means something, otherwise...

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Where is it?  Where'd it go?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Stay low.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Where the hell is it!?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Just stay down.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: What are we going to do?  What the hell are we going to do?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: We're not going to do anything.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: They're going to kill us!

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: They can't shoot us in here.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: If they land--

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: If they land, we can take them.  If they don't land, then we've got nothing to worry about.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Think there might be more Iraqis?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Right now I wouldn't be surprised if Eartha Kitt showed up singing Send In The Clowns.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: A whole lot of nothing.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: So where do we start?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: What does it look like I'm doing?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: It looks like you're not doing anything.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: I'm not.  And I'm not doing anything, because there's nothing down here.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Get up and dig.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: We've been digging.  We've been digging for hours.  If there was anything here to find we would have found it.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Get up off your ass and dig!

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Must be a compartment.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: I feel air.  Probably opens up outside somewhere.  That's where the light comes from.  Couldn't see it with the lanternon.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Maybe we should blast it loose with the claymore.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: It's giving.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: It's just a mongoose.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Is it dead?

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: Yeah, Bwana, you got it.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: It's not like I figured.  It's cold.  And it's heavier than I imagined.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: I wouldn't know.  I never imagined this. Not in my whole life did I ever imagine this.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: You don't have to imagine it.  Not anymore.  Now all you've got to think up is what it's going to buy you.

turns.speaker: JAEGER
turns.text: Wait.

turns.speaker: EPPS
turns.text: What?
